decks.notes: This deck focuses on aggressive plays with a combination of powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, supported by heavy removal and disruption spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial. The mana base is diverse to support the 4/5c Aggro archetype, allowing for consistent plays and enabling powerful spells like Tribal Flames. The Leyline cards provide additional protection and synergy with the rest of the deck, while Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Winternight Stories serve as powerful finishers to seal the game.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Amulet of Vigor to gain additional value from lands entering the battlefield untapped. By combining this with cards like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift, the strategy aims to quickly ramp into powerful threats like Urza's Saga and Crumbling Vestige. The inclusion of cards like Boseiju, Who Endures and Gruul Turf allows for additional support and protection. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble powerful combinations of lands and creatures to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on aggressively attacking the opponent with a mix of powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Scion of Draco, and Territorial Kavu. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help control the board and protect your creatures. Lightning Bolt provides additional removal and reach. Stubborn Denial offers a way to counter opponent's spells. The deck also includes some land manipulation with cards like Flooded Strand, Wooded Foothills, and Arid Mesa. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with efficient creatures and removal spells.

The main idea of this deck is to assemble a combo utilizing Basking Broodscale and Blade of the Bloodchief to generate a large number of tokens with powerful abilities. The deck also includes Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Glaring Fleshraker to provide additional threats and disruption. The goal is to control the game with removal spells like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble while using cards like Ancient Stirrings and Urza's Saga to find key combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and synergistic combo interactions.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The key strategy is to use cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu to deal damage quickly, while also using Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding to control the opponent's board. Stubborn Denial provides protection from removal spells, while Arena of Glory can help provide additional creature boosts. The deck aims to be fast and efficient, utilizing a mix of red, green, and white mana sources to support its aggressive gameplay.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the powerful Amulet Titan combo by utilizing cards like Amulet of Vigor, Primeval Titan, and Urza's Saga. By efficiently ramping with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Scapeshift, the deck can quickly generate a massive amount of mana to overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Lotus Field and Aftermath Analyst provide additional ways to generate mana and search for key combo pieces. The deck also includes lands like Golgari Rot Farm and Simic Growth Chamber to further accelerate the deck's mana production.

The deck focuses on quickly and efficiently reanimating powerful creatures, such as Griselbrand and Atraxa, using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Faithful Mending. It utilizes counter magic like Force of Negation and disruptive spells like Thoughtseize to protect its combo pieces. The deck also includes cards like Ephemerate and Solitude for additional value and protection. Overall, the strategy revolves around setting up a game-winning combo as fast as possible while disrupting the opponent's plans through control elements.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to have a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing cheap and efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Slickshot Show-Off, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge to pump up creatures and push for more damage. The deck aims to apply pressure early in the game and outpace the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts and leveraging them for aggressive plays and resource denial. It aims to flood the board with artifacts like Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary, supported by cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum for fast mana generation. Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt help control the opponent's board, while Urza's Saga and Emry, Lurker of the Loch provide additional value by recurring artifacts. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, artifact-centric strategy that is difficult to disrupt.

The main idea of this deck is to use a combination of Broodscale creatures and support cards to quickly ramp up mana and summon powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End. By controlling the board with cards like Malevolent Rumble and Glaring Fleshraker, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its high-powered creatures and disruptive spells. Additionally, the deck utilizes artifact lands and Ugin's Labyrinth to provide additional mana acceleration and protection. It combines aggression and control elements to create a devastating combo strategy.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent. Utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Gemstone Caverns and Eldrazi Temple, the deck aims to play threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths early in the game. Chalice of the Void and Ugin's Labyrinth help disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Glaring Fleshraker and It That Heralds the End provide additional pressure. With a mix of creatures, spells, and lands that support Eldrazi synergy, this deck aims to win the game through aggressive plays and efficient threats.

The deck focuses on generating powerful mana ramp with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to quickly ramp into Primeval Titan or Scapeshift. The goal is to assemble the Amulet Titan combo, which allows the player to search for key lands like Vesuva or Gruul Turf and take advantage of their ETB effects multiple times in a single turn. By utilizing lands like Tolaria West and Lotus Field, the deck aims to quickly generate a large amount of mana and overwhelm opponents with powerful threats and combo potential.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly with cards like Desperate Ritual and Pyretic Ritual to cast big spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames. It aims to chain together multiple spells in a single turn to generate a large storm count, which can then be capitalized on with cards like Grapeshot and Heroes' Hangout for a lethal finish. The inclusion of cards like Wrenn's Resolve and Wish allow for flexibility and protection, while Valakut Awakening helps to dig for key combo pieces. Overall, the deck relies on speed and synergy to overwhelm the opponent quickly.

The deck focuses on leveraging instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to quickly bring back powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier. By combining this strategy with cards like Ephemerate and Faithful Mending to protect and dig for combo pieces, the deck aims to create a fast and unpredictable game plan that overwhelms the opponent. Additional disruption and control elements like Force of Negation, Thoughtseize, and Teferi, Time Raveler help support the combo plan, while sideboard options can be customized to suit the current metagame.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive early-game plays with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, backed up by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. The deck also utilizes powerful anthems like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Arena of Glory to pump up its creatures and close out games quickly. Additionally, the inclusion of disruptive cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison can disrupt opponent's strategies and give the deck an edge in certain matchups. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and efficient aggro strategy.

Utilizing a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and card draw, this Mono Black Control deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The deck's win condition revolves around recurring threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Boggart Trawler while draining the opponent's life total with Soul Spike and other direct damage spells. With a focus on resource denial and attrition, the deck seeks to grind out victories through efficient removal and card advantage.
